flow.descriptionCdata:
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.15da0e6f-1175-4364-8091-983a769959b1.description= 
Adds an annotation to the supplied HP OVO/W Message

Input Paramters\:
host - hostname of the HP OVO/W server
msgId - message id (GUID) of the message to add an annotation too
text - the text of the annotation
username - the username
password - password

Outputs\:
success - the annotation was added successfully
failure - unable to add annotation
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.1926d108-a53b-44e8-9d6a-dd5f66d51fa5.description=
Create an incident ticket.

Inputs\:
host - The DNS name or IP Address of your Service Manager host.
port - The port to connect to your Service Manager host.
protocol - The protocol to connect to your Service Manager host. This value can be either HTTP or HTTPS.
username - The username for the Service Manager host.
password - The password for the Service Manager user.
smVersion - Version of Service Manager. If the value is empty or contains spaces only, the default version 'sm93x' will be used.
alertStatus - Alert status.
assignee - Assignee of the ticket. Maps to "Assignee Name" in SM 7.00, 7.01.
assignmentGroup - Assignment group of the ticket.  Maps to "Primary Assignment Group" in SM 7.00, 7.01 (This field is optional when creating a new incident in SM 9.3x with Process Designer Content Pack 9.30.3 installed, but is mandatory for all other versions).
briefDescription - Brief description (one-line). Maps to "Title" in SM 7.10,7.11,9.20,93x and "Incident title" in SM 7.01,7.00.
category - Ticket category.
closedBy - Ticket closer. Maps to "Closed" in SM 7.00, 7.01, 7.10, 7.11 ("History" tab).
closureCode - Ticket closure code. Maps to "Resolution Code" in SM 7.00, 7.01 ("Activities" tab).
configItem - Configuration item. Maps to "Affected CI" in SM 7.10, SM 7.11, SM9.20, SM9.3x and to "Affected Item" in SM 7.00, 7.01 ("CI's and Services" tab).
contact - Contact for the ticket. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident in SM 7.10, 7.11, 9.20, 9.3x.
description - Ticket description. Maps to "Incident Description" in SM 7.00, 7.01.
initialImpact - Initial impact (for example\: 1,2,3). Maps to "Impact" in SM 7.10, 7.11, 9.20, 9.3x and to "Initial Impact Assessment" in SM 7.00, 7.01.
journalUpdates - Update history (new-line delimited) in the "Activities" tab.
openedBy - Ticket opener. Maps to "Opened" in SM 7.00, 7.01, 7.10, 7.11 ("History" tab).
problemType - Problem type. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident in SM 7.10, 7.11, 9.20 and 9.3x. Required for SM 7.00 and 7.01, optional for SM 7.10, 7.11,  9.20 and 9.3x.
productType - Product type. Maps to "Sub-area" in SM 7.10, 7.11 and 9.20.  Maps to "Area" in SM 9.3x with Process Designer Content Pack 9.30.3 installed (This field is optional when creating a new incident in SM 9.3x with Process Designer Content Pack 9.30.3 installed, but is mandatory for all other versions).
resolution - Ticket resolution information. Maps to "Solution" in SM 7.00, 7.01, 7.10, 7.11, 9.20 and 9.3x.
resolutionFixType - Fix method for the ticket (permanent or temporary).  Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
service - Affected service with ticket. Not available for SM 7.00, 7.01. 
severity - Severity (sometimes called User Priority). Maps to "Urgency" in SM 7.00, 7.01, 7.10, 7.11, 9.20 and 9.3x.
slaAgreementID - SLA Agreement ID. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
solution - Ticket solution. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
subCategory - Subcategory. Maps to "Area" in SM 7.10,7.11,9.20. Maps to "Subcategory" in SM 9.3x with Process Designer Content Pack 9.30.3 installed (This field is optional when creating a new incident in SM 9.3x with Process Designer Content Pack 9.30.3 installed, but is mandatory for all other versions).
ticketOwner - Ticket owner. Maps to "Owner" in SM 7.00, 7.01, 7.10, 7.11, 9.20, 9.3x.
updatedBy - User name of last updater. Maps to "Last updated" in SM 7.00, 7.01, 7.10, 7.11 ("History" tab).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Error occurred.

Returns\:
smMessage - A brief message of a Service Manager request.
smMessages - Additional messages of a Service manager request.
smReturnCode - The return code of a Service Manager request.
smStatus - The return status of a Service Manager request.
id - Ticket ID.

Note\:
Refer to the following steps on the SM 7.00/7.01 client to view a list of recommended values for siteCategory\:
1. From the System Navigator, click Tailoring > Forms Designer.
2. In the Form field, type IM.template.update.g.
3. Click the Design button on the tool bar of the 'Forms Designer' tab.
4. Click the Site Category combo box.
5. In the Properties section, scroll down and visualize the editable 'Value List' property, which contains the values recommended for siteCategory. The default values are\: A, B, C, D and remote.
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.2b06927b-993a-4ffb-8c8d-ced19fe99d00.description=Sleeps for "X" seconds. Inputs\: seconds - The number of seconds to sleep. Responses\: success - Slept for "X" seconds. failure - was unable to sleep for some reason 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.40b91d9a-6b4d-48fd-a0f9-1ae1bbfe8466.prompt=ID 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.46c728d4-7b38-4613-babe-22ba7afe22fc.description=
Starts a service if it's start mode is set to Automatic.

Inputs\:
host - the host to start the service on.
service - the service to start.
altuser - username for host.
altpass - password for altuser.

Responses\:
start type is not automatic - service not started, because its start type is not automatic.
failure - could not determine service start type, or could not start service.
success - service started.
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.5d02edab-82dd-4372-9b42-d4e5d8495907.description=Service to perform an HTTP GET via the Java HTTP Client inputs\: url - the url to GET get from. username - The username to use for basic authentication to the url password - The password to use for basic authentication to the url trustAllRoots - enables weak security over SSL. A SSH certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it. valid options are\: true/false useCookies - Enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. valid options are\: true/false timeout - a timeout after which the connection should be terminated, or 0 for no timeout. follow redirects - specifies whether or not the get command should automatically follow redirects. proxy - a proxy to use when accessing the web site. proxyPort - a port on the proxy to connect to. proxyUsername - a username to use when connecting to the proxy. proxyPassword - a password to use when connecting to the proxy. Results\: document - The Complete document returned by the GET operation PageLoadTimeInMS - The number of milliseconds it took the page to load. ResponseTimeInMS - The number of milliseconds it took before the server responded. Responses\: success - The GET command completed PAGE_NOT_FOUND - The url specified to GET from could not be found. INFORMATIONAL - The GET was not fully processed, the server responded with an informational response REDIRECTION - The specified URL has moved. failure - The GET operation failed. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.5f61e24c-567b-42bf-b0aa-c2f833b01095.description= 
Acknowledges a message in HP OVO/W

Input Parameters\:
Input Paramters\:
host - hostname of the HP OVO/W server
msgId - message id (GUID) of the message to acknowledge
username - the username
password - password

Outputs\:
success - the message was acknowledged successfully
failure - unable to acknowledge message
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.63cc75f4-fd41-467a-9a04-5e1664d9ae78.prompt=Enter HP OM message ID\: 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.6ebee521-c4d0-4e9e-9859-b643532e0e05.transition.description=Annotated OM alert message ID ${msgId} with OO execution URL. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.7003188e-8148-4d3f-9bc2-5bc807c70d1a.transition.description=Service Manager Ticket Id\: ${incidentId} 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.7c383202-b2e1-4288-a226-f67cc88f7c41.transition.description=Waited ${seconds} seconds for restart. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.7d7483db-3d1a-47be-a6ea-bcbaa6787973.transition.description=Could not take ownership of OM alert message ID ${msgId}. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.920a7828-3cef-443a-a8ce-632044cebaad.prompt=Host 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.9bbbc0e5-7af3-4e7f-8534-345f6189eac8.description=
Adds an annotation to the supplied HP OVO/W Message

Inputs\:
host - hostname of the HP OVO/W server
msgId - message id (GUID) of the message to add an annotation too
text - the text of the annotation
username - the username
password - password

Responses\:
success - the annotation was added successfully
failure - unable to add annotation
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.a17ee3ed-c992-4fbe-b0e6-2db614865fa7.transition.description=The tomcat6 service was sucessfully restarted. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.a521b430-50e2-4066-be75-fa7a2772b037.description= 
Takes ownership of a message in HP OVO/W

Input Parameters\:
Input Paramters\:
host - hostname of the HP OVO/W server
msgId - message id (GUID) of the message to own
username - the username
password - password

Outputs\:
success - the message ownership has been changed
failure - unable to change message ownership
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.a601150b-574c-47fe-88d9-febfae8a04b2.transition.description=The ${service} service is already running. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.af326c18-cbe8-4889-b07e-817818bcb465.transition.description=Acknowledged Operations manager alert message id ${msgId} 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.c195f7b6-c617-4103-9bce-1e30801c4760.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.e10e6a52-ec24-4a88-870a-707e10c24e95.description=
Resolves an incident ticket (This action is not available in SM 9.3x with Process Designer Content Pack 9.30.3 installed).

Inputs\:
host - The DNS name or IP Address of your Service Manager host.
port - The port to connect to your Service Manager host.
protocol - The protocol to connect to your Service Manager host. This value can be either HTTP or HTTPS.
username - The user name of the Service Manager host.
password - The password of the Service Manager user.
smVersion - Version of Service Manager. If the value is empty or contains spaces only, the default version 'sm93x' will be used.
id - ID of the ticket.
resolve - Resolve ticket? Reject if not "true" or "yes".
solution - Ticket solution.
resolutionFixType - Fix method for the ticket (for SM 7.00 and 7.01, valid values should be either "permanent" or "temporary").

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Error occurred.

Returns\:
smMessage - A brief message of a Service Manager request.
smMessages - Additional messages of a Service manager request.
smReturnCode - The return code of a Service Manager request.
smStatus - The return status of a Service Manager request.
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.e5e2c4b2-9911-4e60-958c-75c086283867.description=
Get the current status of a Windows service

Inputs\:
host - hostname or ip address of the target machine
service - name of service to change
user - alternate credentials username
password - alternate credentials password

Responses\:
service paused - the service is currently paused
service running - the service is currently running
service stopped - the service is currently stopped
service pending - the service is currently pending
failure - there was a problem getting the state of the service
87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.f100c4ea-9315-4e3d-8dbb-61ce95689f47.transition.description=Took ownership of OM alert message ID ${msgId}. 87ec8aa1-05c5-4de3-9fb0-60228db60a40.f7fa5bc0-1d8f-4e49-b70f-661d91e2a37d.transition.description=Incident ticket ${incidentId} was created and noted in OM alert message ${msgId}.
flow.name: Repair Tomcat( Netcool)

returnStep.name: No Action Taken : Service is Running

step.name: Add Flow Report URL to HPE OpsB Message

staticBinding.value: The HP Operations Orchestration flow report is available here: http://oo.advantageinc.hpswdemo.com:8080/oo/#/runtimeWorkspace/runs
Incident ticket ${incidentId} was created in Service Manager.
[Operations Manager] Tomcat server was repaired successfully. OM Incident ${msgId} was closed
[Operations Manager] Problem detected with Tomcat Server; HP Operations Orchestration has acknowledged the incident ID ${msgId} and is beginning repairs.
